subSubSection.paragraph: Adults of C. cinereum differ from the similar South American C. torticolle Bates, 1870 by the basal antenommere not reaching the anterior margin of the pronotum, pronotal gibbosity scarecely apparent; prosternal process not exceeding the procoxae; and middle femoral apical spines not markedly projected ( Olivier 1795 , Gahan 1892 ). According to Martins (2004) , the distinctions between C. cinereum and C. torticolle have always been problematic. (Fig. 1)
